title: Tangerine

adjectives: Of a strong reddish orange color
Having or denoting the characteristic taste of sugar
Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.
Having the colour of the fruit of an orange tree.
Of the color between red and yellow; similar to the color of a ripe orange
Having the colour of a ripe orange; a reddish-yellow.
Having the colour of the fruit of an orange tree; yellowred; reddish-yellow.
Recently made, produced, or harvested (e.g. bread, scent, etc.).
verbs: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.
nouns: Round yellow to orange fruit of any of several citrus trees
The ripened reproductive body of a seed plant
Fruit, in broad terms, is a structure of a plant that contains its seeds.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, often edible, colourful/colorful and fragrant, produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
A fully matured plant ovary with or without other floral or shoot parts united with it at maturity.
In botany, a fruit is a part of a flowering plant that derives from specific tissues of the flower, one or more ovaries, and in some cases accessory tissues.
Tangerine is an orange color hue used to give the impression of the tangerine fruit.
A deep yellowish-orange colour, like that of a tangerine fruit.
A reddish to vivid orange color
An orange color hue used to give the impression of the tangerine fruit
Any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body. For prepared ready-to-eat food, use dish: Q746549.
Any substance consumed by living organisms to sustain life.
Any substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
Any solid substance (as opposed to liquid) that is used as a source of nourishment
Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

description: An orange-colored citrus fruit with a green leaf or leaves and stem. Officially depicting a tangerine, a type of mandarin (mikan in Japan). Often used as a garden-variety orange. Either way, a good source of vitamin C.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the tangerine emoji is a vibrant burst of citrus, rendered with a rich, textured peel that appears juicy and ripe, thanks to Apple‚Äôs realistic lighting and subtle glossy 3D shading. Its soft rounded edges give it a plump, inviting appearance, and the bright orange hue is instantly recognizable and cheerful. This emoji evokes feelings of freshness, sweetness, and a delightful zesty flavor, commonly used to add a touch of natural goodness or a bright, sunny disposition to messages.
